alert.note: Alert for Craighead; Cross; Greene; Poinsett (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 12:57AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greene, Craighead, western Poinsett and north central Cross Counties through 130 AM CST... At 1256 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Waldenburg, or 11 miles west of Harrisburg, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jonesboro, Paragould, Trumann, Harrisburg, Bono, Lake City, Bay, Brookland, Crowleys Ridge State Park, Lake Frierson State Park, Weiner, Cherry Valley, Cash, Egypt, Waldenburg, Walcott, Fontaine, Greenfield, Fisher and Apt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CST for eastern Arkansas.
